abstract: Federal Judge Mary S Scriven temporarily blocks a far-reaching Florida law that requires public assistance applicants to take a drug test, saying the law probably violates a constitutional ban on unreasonable search and seizure.
snippet: A federal judge temporarily blocked a law requiring public assistance applicants to take a drug test, saying it is probably an intrusion on their Fourth Amendment rights.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge temporarily blocked a law requiring public assistance applicants to take a drug test, saying it is probably an intrusion on their Fourth Amendment rights.

headline.main: Florida: Judge Blocks Welfare Drug Tests
headline.print_headline: Florida: Judge Blocks Welfare Drug Tests
headline.seo: Welfare Drug Test Requirement Blocked in Florida
